properties.name: 's-Hertogenbosch
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Home town of Jetse de Vries, editor of the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: A Tiny off the Coast of the Philippines
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The island of last resort for Roy Parekh -- as told in Jason Stoddard\'s "Overhead" -- where he hides, while still being in touch enough to keep Intelligent Risk (and it\'s continued Moon missions) running as long as possible...

properties.name: A small cenote
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A thatch hut near a small cenote, where Valeria\'s grandmother makes a precious if also happy living, as told in "Riding in Mexico".

properties.name: A small corner cafe near the canal in Amsterdam
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A small corner café at the edge of the canal in Amsterdam, kept off the geogrid by ex-geohackers, so it\'s only for \'those in the know\'. The favourite lunch place for Jaouad and Alex as told in "A Thousand Trains Out of Here".

properties.name: A small, slumped house
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A small, slumped house where Valeria\'s mother lives, and the drug trafficking people she\'s involved with, much to Isa\'s distress and Valeria\'s regret (as told in "Riding in Mexico").

properties.name: Administrator's Quonset Hut Offices
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Administrators\' Quonset Hut Offices on Little Yunhe Square where Yuen\'s brother Xiaohao made his first, rather futile, presentation, as told in "The Earth of Yunhe". Will he and Yuen be more successful a seond time?

properties.name: Antwerp Prison
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine In a white room in a prison (well, not *outside*) in Antwerp, where Marcin was beginning to a 40 year sentence on several charges, but basically because he unleashed the \'Dalí\'s Clocks\' virus, as told in "Dalí\'s Clocks".

properties.name: Asia, Hong Kong
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine New flu vaccines -- released through the Spanish consultancy Pensamiento Aplicado -- effective against the highly contagious bird flu virus, as narrated in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: At the outskirts of the Zoetermeer district
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Egyptians had chosen one of Jaouad\'s own developments for their meeting, where solar collectors and photovoltaic panelling had been replaced by a variety of straight and curved elements in carefully selected shades. In a way, it looked like a forest (as told in "A Thousand Trains Out of Here").

properties.name: Bay of Bengal
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine At the Bay of Bengal; wind towers, reforestation and tidal control has reduced flooding, soil erosion and the number of cyclone landfalls, in a co-ordinated defence implemented by the Spanish consultation firm Penasamiento Aplicado -- as told in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powell & Aliette de Bodard in the SHINE anthology

properties.name: Beijing’s Best Happiness and Prosperity Vertical Farm No. 1
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A possible location for a future vertical farm called "Beijing’s Best Happiness and Prosperity Vertical Farm No. 1" run by Shu Mei Feng\'s parents in "The Branding of Shu Mei Feng".

properties.name: Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Bilbao: the city where Lisa and Stéphane sail to in search for a better (and very uncertain) future, as narrated in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Boubara
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Boubara, where the village woman pound manioc and palm nuts. Until they find a more \'sustainable\' way of doing it in "Sustainable Development", as told by Paula R. Stiles...

properties.name: Bristol
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Gareth Lyn Powell, co-author of "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" from the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Chili Pequeno
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Chili Pequeno
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Chili Pequeno: the future imaginary bar where Lance and Alice-Marie have their -- gender flip-flopping -- affair...

properties.name: City Park Wilderness
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Pockets of wilderness (from abandoned city parks, left to flourish or die) that are now being reclaimed in a future, unnamed North American city -- that went from continental wealth to continental poverty -- and is, ever so gradually, adapting to new circumstances, as narrated in "Summer Ice"...

properties.name: Drought-resistant wheat in Sub-Saharan Africa
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Pensamiento Aplicado’s initial success: the implementation of drought-resistant wheat in Subsaharan Africa, as told in "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powell & Aliette de Bodard in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Edge Grand Central
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Rotterdam, the future \'Edge Grand Central\' station (as told in "A Thousand Trains Out of Here"), where Jaouad finally finds his friend Alex, on a platform where a rocket-like ATGV with lightning-blue sides is patiently waiting...

properties.name: Enormous Landscaped Garden
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine An enormous lanscaped garden in the grounds of a villa belonging to a man who was rumoured to be a Capo di tutti capi. Jarek had an argument with Caroline -- one of the few persons, like Jarek, immune to the \'Dalí\'s Clocks\' virus -- about its relative merit, as told in "Dalí\'s Clocks".

properties.name: Eric Gregory
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Home town of SHINE anthology writer -- of "The Earth of Yunhe" -- Eric Gregory.

properties.name: Folk Hotel, KAESŎNG
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Folk Hotel in KAESŎNG, where Sergeant Wall and his party are awaiting the approach of enemy forces in a future war with North Korea, as told in "Fembot". Will they survive the confrontation, or will the \'fembot\' -- the next incarnation of Rafael Toledo -- distract them?

properties.name: Holly Phillips
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Victoria, home town of Holly Phillips, author of "Summer Ice": a story in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Home Town of Jacques Barcia
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Jacques Barcia: SHINE author of "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up"!

properties.name: Ice Sculpture
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine An ice sculpture made by Manon in the freezer of a befriended ice cream shop -- as told in "Summer Ice" -- now displayed in the park of an unnamed North American city (which went from \'continental wealth to continental poverty\') as an ethereal signpost marking the transition between worlds.

properties.name: Island with intelligent coral
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A small island near Vanua Lava surrounded with intelligent coral, grown for organic computing, as told in "The Solnet Ascendancy".

properties.name: Jason Stoddard
properties.description: Posted by DaybreakmagazineSanta Clarita: home town of SHINE author Jason Stoddard, who wrote "Overhead". Excerpt of the story in the link!

properties.name: Just Past Fifth Ring Road
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Hangtian Technology Center, one the (future) defunct industrial parks just past Fifth Ring Road where Shu Mai Feng -- in "The Branding of Shu Mei Feng" -- and Lin Qi have an accident with a motorcycle...

properties.name: Kichwa Tembo
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Kichwa Tembo, where Simba -- the lion from Zoo Atlanta -- and the three lionesses are reintroduced in the wild by Diana -- protagonist of "The Courage of the Lion Tamer" -- and her team.

properties.name: Little Wuxi
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Little Wuxie, where Yuen -- the main character from "The Earth of Yunhe" -- repairs one of the waether accumulators in a future China.

properties.name: Mount Rainier
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Mount Rainier: the place where the flesh-and-blood Neicy always wanted to take her friend Tilda, but never quite succeeded. However -- as told in "She\'s All Light" -- now that Neicy\'s \'scaped\', Tilda is seriously considering it...

properties.name: Newish Block of flats overlooking the Warta
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The newish block of flats overlooking the Warta just outside the Old Town where Jarek -- one of the main characters in "Dalí\'s Clocks" -- lived before the \'Dalí\'sClocks\' virus was unleased.

properties.name: North End of Napa
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Paradise Springs Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by DaybreakmagazineThe (future?) Paradise Springs Golf Course where Roy Parekh -- one of the main characters in "Overhead" -- makes the deal with Thom Lymann to set up the FOLR (Fund of Last Resort), which will eventually finance the Moonbase.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Paris: home town of Aliette de Bodard, co-author of "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" in the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Patient Whale
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The vessel where Xiaohao -- Yuen\'s brother in "The Earth of Yunhe"-- is kept imprisoned after he unleashed his crazy ideas from Ecclesia, meant to restore Yunhe\'s environment from the ground up...

properties.name: Paula R. Stiles
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Vancouver: home town of Paula R. Stiles, author of "Sustainable Development" from the SHINE anthology.

properties.name: Place de la Nation
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Place de la Nation: where Lisa met up with Stéphane during a protest march, as narrated in "The Church of Acclerated Redemption" by Gareth Lyn Powll & Aliette de Bodard.

properties.name: Playa del Carmen, East of the stinking resorts
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Near Playa del Carmen, \'East of the stinking resorts\', Valeria -- the host ridden by Isa as told in "Riding in Mexico" -- laments how \'the reefs have been bleached by excess, by pigs who burn too much gasoline and tourists with sunscreen\'.

properties.name: Préfecture de Paris
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Via the Paris\'Préfacture website Lisa -- the main character from "The Church of Accelerated Redemption" -- finds out where the strange manin the Bedouin scarf she saw across, indeed, the Church of Accelerated Redemption, might show up again...

properties.name: Remember Tangier?
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine "Remember Tangier?" The plave where Jaouad and Alex first met, and which had taken a near mystical gloss as they didn\'t return to it together (as told in "A Thousand Trains Out of Here").

properties.name: Salkhit Mountain Wind Farm
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Salkhit Mountain Wind Farm: an EBRD investment for a wind farm in Mongolia, near Khangai Nuruu Park (where Khongoryn Els: the \'singing dunes\' are located). Maybe this is where Shu Mei Feng eventually will become a wind turbine technician?

properties.name: Seattle University
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Seattle University, where Summer drizzle has made jewelry out of spiderwebs, and where Isa, her friend Kay, and others voluntarily experiment with \'riding\' host in Third World countries, a new technology as narrated in "Riding in Mexico".

properties.name: Sky City Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Sky City restaurant: where (as told in "She\'s All Light") Tilda has dinner with Peggy95 (who is, like Tilda\'s friend Neicy, also a \'scaper), and slowly comes to grips with the fact that her best friend is now purely virtual...

properties.name: SkyCity Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine

properties.name: Sultanpet
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Bangalore and surrounds: where most of the action in "The Very Difficult Diwali of Sub-Inpsector Gurushankar Rajaram" takes place!

properties.name: Sultanpet
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Bangalore (and surrounds), where most of the action in "The Very Difficult Diwali of Sub-Inspector Gurushankar Rajaram" takes place!

properties.name: Surrealist Sculptor in Barcelona
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Possible location of a (future) surrealist sculptor in Barcelona, where Jarek is asked to evaluate his latest sculpture, apparently made entirely from human toenail clippings (as told in "Dalí\'s Clocks", and reality sometimes overtakes fiction...;-).

properties.name: São José’s Market
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The \'Black Market\' square where Inácio finds out more about a company called Gear5 -- who are using up huge amounts of carbon credits -- in "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up.

properties.name: Tel Aviv
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Lavie Tidhar, author of "The Solnet Ascendancy", who is originally from Israel, but has moved around the world (South Africa, the UK, Vanuatu and Laos at the last count).

properties.name: Thar desert
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine People who rode dromedaries and lived in the Thar desert near the border with Pakistan. Isa\'s friend Kay got to \'ride\' one of them -- Bani -- while Isa (who wanted one of the Indian people) got a Mexican woman -- Valeria -- to \'ride\', as told in "Riding in Mexico".

properties.name: The Market House on Sola
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The Market House in Sola, Vanua Lava, where Fatfat Freddy and Mike Rowe initiate the chain of events leading to "The Solnet Ascendancy", after Freddie\'s seemingly innocuous remark: "I want email." (As narrated in the same titled story in the SHINE anthology).

properties.name: The Wall barring the Sea
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine "HE LOVED THE wall barring the sea. It was his best kept secret, or else he believed it was. Inácio never told it to anyone." The opening sentences of "The Greenman Watches the Black Bar Go Up, Up, Up".

properties.name: The greyish stone pillar at the centre of Dam square
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The greyish stone pillar at the centre of Dam square, where Jaouad was going to find his friend Alex, based on his geotrace (as told in "A Thousand Trains Out of Here"). But Alex had already gone 7 kilometres south...

properties.name: Ukrainian Restaurant on a square next to the cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine The little Ukrainian restaurant where Jarek wanted to enjoy an intense sensory experience as he came down with the side effects of a new drug Marcin was testing. But, as told in "Dalí\'s Clocks", Jarek is immune, and the drug is something else indeed...

properties.name: WŎNSAN
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine In a village near WŎNSAN, private Rafael \'fembot\' Toledo saved the lives of fellow soldiers and several villager through an act of courage as told in the SF story \'Fembot", and was posthumously awarded the Distinguished Service Cross.

properties.name: Zoo Atlanta
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine Simba the lion in Zoo Atlanta, from where he will be transported to Kichwa Tembo in Kenya and reintorduced in the wild in "The Courage of the Lion Tamer"...

properties.name: horrorhouse
properties.description: Posted by Daybreakmagazine A creepy house in a future Portland: the nexus of "horrorhouse"...
